error.signature: ConfigMap exceeds maximum size: the ConfigMap is too large, maximum size is 1048576 bytes

verdict.summary: ConfigMap data exceeds the 1MB etcd object size limit. Data must be reduced or moved to an alternative storage mechanism.

dead_ends.why_fails: Requires cluster admin access, risks etcd stability, and most managed K8s providers don't allow it

dead_ends.action: Base64-encode the data to reduce size
dead_ends.why_fails: Base64 actually increases data size by ~33%, making the problem worse

workarounds.action: Move large data to a PersistentVolume or init container that downloads from object storage
workarounds.how: Use an initContainer to fetch config from S3/GCS, or mount a PVC with the config files

workarounds.action: Split the ConfigMap into multiple smaller ConfigMaps, each under 1MB
workarounds.how: Divide data keys across ConfigMaps and mount each as a separate volume

leads_to.condition: when splitting ConfigMaps and referencing wrong names

preceded_by.condition: when upgrading clusters and ConfigMaps grow over time

frequently_confused_with.distinction: k8s-configmap-too-large covers the explicit size validation error, while configmap-too-large covers the etcd request-too-large error
